result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tayvion J. Foster

defendant.name: Foster, Tayvion J.
defendant.address: 638 S Cogswell Dr, Silver Lake, WI 53170

records.addlTxt:
9:12 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tayvion J. Foster in court, in custody.  Attorney William Paul Michel Ii in court for Tayvion J. Foster. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF327/21CM1191. Attorney Michel advises the Court that parties have received the results from the crime lab yet and is requesting another status. The State does not object. Court recognizes that at the last hearing the State advised that it may take up to 6 months to receive the results back from the crime lab. Court adjourns. Attorney Michel may contact the Court for a new date if the results come in sooner.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Minutes:  9:37am.  Judge Gabriele acting for Branch 3.  22CF327/21CM1191.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Defense counsel is requesting an adjournment; waiting on DNA results.  ADA Huber reports the DNA has not been sent to the lab yet - will do so promptly.  Results could take approx 6mos.  In addition, there are some discovery issues.  No objection by the State to the deft's adjournment request.  Status set for 9/23/22 @ 8:30am.  NOTE - State is moving to sever this case from 22CF328.

Defendant Tayvion J. Foster appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:20 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms,    *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Travis Y Jr, DC

243PM   Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kelly Leibhan.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on March 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Defendant is on a PO Hold. $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
Co deft  Travis L Young Jr
